Summarizing Api

Summarizing is the core function of superspider. An algorithm summarizes the contents, and outputs a table-like json payload.

Usage

In short, here is the format for requesting a summary. 

GET http://{app-domain}/api/summary?url={url} HTTP/1.1

For this instance, say the server is running locally, and you wanted a summary of c9.io. 

GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/api/summary?url=https://c9.io HTTP/1.1

Things to avoid

  • Putting quotes around the url like so:

    GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/api/summary?url="test.com" HTTP/1.1

Payload

Since this api is still small, the only return mime type available is JSON. The json is formatted as follows. 


{
  "time" : {time}, //The time this was generated.
  "structure" : {structure}, // represents what scraping technique was used.
  "passages" : [
    [keywords,text] // passages contains an array of arrays, with keywords and a passage from the webpage.
  ]
}

Here's what a summary for c9.io would look like. 


{
    "structure": "mini",
    "generated_time": "2017-03-19 20:05:52.708097",
    "passages": [
    [
      [
          "app",
          "cloud9",
          "workspace"
      ],
      "\n\n\n                            We use Cloud9 to develop our main application that helps landlords rent out their properties.\n                            It's great to keep your workspace in the cloud so it doesn't matter which machine you are working from.\n                            Everything will be as you left it, and customized to your preferences.\n                            \n"
  ],
  ...
  ]
}
